com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.server

Class CDOServerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.server.CDOServerUtils

  • public abstract class CDOServerUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Sugar for server side CDO usage.

    NOTE: This class is heavily depends on server side services registered to the application context. Be smart when moving this class to other plug-in.

      • commit

        public static org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.commit.CDOCommitInfo commit(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction transaction,
                                                                     java.lang.String userId,
                                                                     @Nullable
                                                                     java.lang.String comment,
                                                                     @Nullable
                                                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                              throws org.eclipse.emf.cdo.util.CommitException
        Commits the specified transaction with someone else user ID to the backend.
        Parameters:
        transaction - the transaction to commit.
        userId - the unique ID of the user.
        comment - comment for the commit.
        monitor - monitor for the progress. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the commit information containing the changes generated by persisting the change set wrapped by the current transaction.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.emf.cdo.util.CommitException - if the commit failed.

        Parameters:
        transaction - the transaction to commit.
        userId - the unique ID of the user.
        comment - comment for the commit.
        notifyWriteAccessHandlers - true if all registered IRepository.WriteAccessHandler registered to the IRepository instance should be notified after a successful backend commit, otherwise false.
        monitor - monitor for the progress. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the commit information containing the changes generated by persisting the change set wrapped by the current transaction.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.emf.cdo.util.CommitException - if the commit failed.

      • commit

        public static java.lang.Iterable<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.commit.CDOCommitInfo> commit(ICDOTransactionAggregator transactionAggregator,
                                                                                         java.lang.String userId,
                                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                                         java.lang.String comment,
                                                                                         boolean notifyWriteAccessHandlers,
                                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                                  throws org.eclipse.emf.cdo.util.CommitException
        Commits the specified transaction with someone else user ID to the backend.
        Parameters:
        transactionAggregator - an aggregator encapsulating an arbitrary number of CDO transactions.
        userId - the unique ID of the user.
        comment - comment for the commit.
        notifyWriteAccessHandlers - true if all registered IRepository.WriteAccessHandler registered to the IRepository instance should be notified after a successful backend commit, otherwise false.
        sendCommitNotification - true is InternalRepository.sendCommitNotification(InternalSession, CDOCommitInfo) should be invoked after successful commit, otherwise false.
        monitor - monitor for the progress. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the commit information containing the changes generated by persisting the change set wrapped by the current transaction.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.emf.cdo.util.CommitException - if the commit failed.

      • sendCommitNotification

        public static void sendCommitNotification(@Nullable
                                          org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.commit.CDOCommitInfo commitInfo)
        Performs a InternalRepository.sendCommitNotification(InternalSession, CDOCommitInfo) on the repository associated with the commit info argument.
        This method does nothing if the commit info argument is either null or representing a failed commit.
        Parameters:
        commitInfo - the commit info to send.

      • getRevision

        @Nullable
public static org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.revision.CDORevision getRevision(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranchVersion branchVersion,
                                                                                     org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.id.CDOID id)
        Returns with the revision of an object given by its unique storage key from the branch version.
        May return with null if the object cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        branchVersion - the version of a CDO branch.
        id - the unique CDO ID of an object.
        Returns:
        the revision of the object or null.

      • getObjectRevisions

        public static java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.revision.CDORevision> getObjectRevisions(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranchPoint branchPoint,
                                                                                                 org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.id.CDOID cdoId)
        Returns with a list of revisions representing the whole life of an object. Each revision represents the actual state of an object. The list is ordered by time-wise, in other words, the first element representing the latest state of the object, the last element is representing the birth of the object given by its unique CDO ID. May return with an empty list, if the object never existed on the specified branch before (inclusive to the branch point timestamp) the branch point.

        This method equivalent to #getObjectRevisions(CDOBranchPoint, CDOID, Integer.MAX_VALUE).

        Parameters:
        branchPoint - the branch point representing the start point.
        cdoId - the unique ID of the object.
        Returns:
        a list of revisions, representing lifecycle of an object. Could be empty list if the object cannot be found.
        See Also:
        getObjectRevisions(CDOBranchPoint, CDOID, int)

      • getObjectRevisions

        public static java.util.List<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.revision.CDORevision> getObjectRevisions(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranchPoint branchPoint,
                                                                                                 org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.id.CDOID cdoId,
                                                                                                 int limit)
        This method behaves equivalently to getObjectRevisions(CDOBranchPoint, CDOID) but stops collecting the revisions (representing the object lifecycle states) after it reaches the limit.

        This could be a more efficient than getObjectRevisions(CDOBranchPoint, CDOID) when client has the CDO ID of a detached object but has no idea when was it deleted. And only the latest existing state is required.

        Or the client has an existing object but would like to compare the current state of that object with the previous state.

        Parameters:
        branchPoint - the branch point.
        cdoId - the unique CDO ID of an object.
        limit - the maximum number of CDO revisions to return.
        Returns:
        a list of CDO configuration. May return with an empty list.

      • checkDuplicateResources

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Throwable checkDuplicateResources(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.revision.CDORevision revision,
                                                                     org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranchPoint targetBranchPoint)
        Returns with a Throwable if a CDO resource given as a revision already exists. Otherwise returns with null.
        Parameters:
        revision - the revision to check.
        Returns:
        a Throwable if the CDO resource already exists.

      • getLastCommitTime

        public static long getLastCommitTime(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranch branch)
        Returns with the last commit time made on the given branch.
        This method will return with Long.MIN_VALUE if no modification has been made on the given branch, hence no commit time is associated with it.
        Parameters:
        branch -
        Returns:
